article: Upset ,Christopher buried his face deep into his pillow.  "What's the matter ,honey?" she asked as she sat down beside him. "Is there some problem I can help with?"  Christopher _ . He didn't really want to tell his mom what was bothering him. " S-something happened at the p-park , " he stammered _ . " l...I lied to Aaron , and now he won ' t talk to me. He knows I lied. "  " why did you do that?" Mom asked gently.  "I...I don ' t know , " murmured Christopher. "I told him I was _ .but I don ' t think he will forgive me. "  "Are you really sorry?" asked Mom.  Christopher nodded. "I don ' t think he'll ever believe me again, said Christopher _ .  Mom _ for a minute. " Honey , do you remember the _ Dad and I used to give you?" she asked. "The ones you called horsey rides?" Christopher nodded, wondering why Mom brought that up. "You thought it was so much fun until you fell _ the ' horse ' one day and hit your head on a chair," said Mom. "After that it took you a long time to trust _ enough to try it again. "  " _ I finally did! " Christopher said eagerly. He thought he knew what his mother was getting at .  "Yes ,and I' m _ Aaron will trust you again, too. " said Mom. " When you lie to someone ,it takes _ for that person to really believe you again. " Mom smiled. " There will also be bad _ of what you ' ve done-like a friend who won ' t speak to you for a while- and Aaron needs time t0 get over what happened. _ ,be a good friend and help him trust you , again. Can you do that?"  Christopher nodded and promised , "I'll be a _ friend l "
